org.apache.taverna.server.master.interfaces

Interface File

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<DirectoryEntry>, DirectoryEntry

    public interface File
extends DirectoryEntry
    Represents a file in the working directory of a workflow instance run, or in some sub-directory of it.
    Author:
    Donal Fellows
    See Also:
    Directory

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void appendContents(byte[] data)
      Append the data to the file.
      void copy(File from)
      Asks for the argument file to be copied to this one.
      byte[] getContents(int offset, int length) 
      long getSize() 
      void setContents(byte[] data)
      Write the data to the file, totally replacing what was there before.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.apache.taverna.server.master.interfaces.DirectoryEntry

        destroy, getFullName, getModificationDate, getName

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Comparable

        compareTo

    • Method Detail

      • getContents

        byte[] getContents(int offset,
                   int length)
            throws FilesystemAccessException
        Parameters:
        offset - Where in the file to start reading.
        length - The length of file to read, or -1 to read to the end of the file.
        Returns:
        The literal byte contents of the section of the file, or null if the section doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        FilesystemAccessException - If the read of the file goes wrong.

      • setContents

        void setContents(byte[] data)
          throws FilesystemAccessException
        Write the data to the file, totally replacing what was there before.
        Parameters:
        data - The literal bytes that will form the new contents of the file.
        Throws:
        FilesystemAccessException - If the write to the file goes wrong.

      • appendContents

        void appendContents(byte[] data)
             throws FilesystemAccessException
        Append the data to the file.
        Parameters:
        data - The literal bytes that will be added on to the end of the file.
        Throws:
        FilesystemAccessException - If the write to the file goes wrong.

      • getSize

        long getSize()
      throws FilesystemAccessException
        Returns:
        The length of the file, in bytes.
        Throws:
        FilesystemAccessException - If the read of the file size goes wrong.

      • copy

        void copy(File from)
   throws FilesystemAccessException
        Asks for the argument file to be copied to this one.
        Parameters:
        from - The source file.
        Throws:
        FilesystemAccessException - If anything goes wrong.
